alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 3:51AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM CHST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...South-central Guam, south of a eastern Tamuning to Latte Heights line. * WHEN...Until 545 AM ChST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 351 AM ChST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Doppler radar estimates and automated rain gauges show one half inch to 1 inch of rainfall has occurred with some locally higher amounts. Additional rainfall will move through the region over the next 2 hours with one hour rainfall rates of similar values. Although widespread flooding is not anticipated at this time, some localized flooding in poor drainage areas are possible, especially south of Cross Island Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dededo, Tamuning, Yigo, Mangilao, Chalan Pago-Ordot, Barrigada, Yona, Hagatna Heights, Talofofo, Mongmong-Toto- Maite, Sinajana, Inarajan, Asan, Merizo, Piti, Santa Rita and Umatac. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
